plants.name: Lilium auratum
plants.description: A stunning lily native to Japan known for its large, fragrant white flowers with golden stripes and freckled spots. It blooms in summer and is highly prized in horticulture.
plants.funFact: Lilium auratum is often called the 'King of Lilies' due to its majestic size and striking fragrance.

plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant characterized by its large flower heads with bright yellow ray florets and dark brown centers. Sunflowers track the sunâ€™s movement across the sky during the day (heliotropism) especially in bud stage.
plants.location: Native to North America, widely cultivated globally
plants.funFact: Sunflowers can grow exceptionally tall, some varieties exceeding 3 meters (10 feet) in height.

plants.name: Eryngium maritimum
plants.description: A spiny, silver-blue wildflower found on sandy sea coasts of Europe. It adds a unique architectural element to coastal dunes and blooms midsummer.
plants.location: European coastal dunes, Mediterranean to Atlantic coasts
plants.funFact: The name 'Eryngium' originates from the Greek word 'Eryngion', where it was believed to have medicinal properties.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An evergreen flowering tree native to Australia that produces bright orange to yellow brush-like flowers, popular in subtropical gardens.
plants.location: Eastern Australia, also cultivated in similar climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its common name 'Silky Oak', this tree is not a true oak, and its wood is prized for furniture making due to its durability and attractive grain.
